text: this little guy is Carlo sadly his older

mostly in journalism we focus on the

when Carlo became sick his family
theories that they may lose him I found

now this area is in dispute so there's
no medical help from the Sudanese

doctor Eider orders up a blood test
saving kids lives in places like this is
simple and inexpensive it starts with

we've cracked the code
on saving children's lives back in 1960
20 million children died each year from
poverty UNICEF announced recently that
the figure has now dropped below 10
million for the first time just think
about that 10 million children's lives
saved each year that's a hundred million
lives saved each decade the tests do
show that Carlo has malaria he'll be
given a medication that is almost always
effective against malaria here
it cost us 50 cents for an entire course
of treatment now UNICEF is aiming to cut
the death toll for children again down
